title: Microsoft Teams Onboarding for Remote Tech Professionals
description: A 3-day microlearning course focusing on essential Microsoft Teams features tailored to developers and IT staff. Combines hands-on exercises with technical troubleshooting scenarios.
goal: Enable remote technical staff to independently use core Microsoft Teams features (chat, channels, meetings, files) within 3 workdays through microlearning modules
audience: Technical professionals (developers, IT staff) working remotely full-time

sections.title: Navigating the Dashboard
sections.description: Identify key elements (activity feed, chat list, apps tab) and customize the interface for productivity

sections.title: Basic Chat Operations
sections.description: Create direct chats vs. group chats; use @mentions and reaction buttons effectively

sections.title: Quick Start Guide to Channels
sections.description: Differentiate between public/private channels; join existing teams and access pinned resources

sections.title: First Day Exercise: Setup Profile & Preferences
sections.description: Configure status messages, notification settings, and accessibility features relevant for remote work

sections.title: Advanced Chat Settings
sections.description: Manage read receipts, message retention policies, and integration with Trello/Slack bots

sections.title: Common Chat Issues Resolution
sections.description: Diagnose delivery failures, recover deleted messages, and block spam accounts

sections.title: Collaborative Documentation via Chat
sections.description: Use @mention syntax to tag code snippets; share files directly from chat threads

sections.title: Scenario-Based Exercise: Resolve a Simulated Chat Outage
sections.description: Walk through step-by-step troubleshooting with provided error logs

sections.title: Organizing Workflows Through Channels
sections.description: Create sub-channels for project phases; use pinned messages for critical documentation

sections.title: Permissions & Security Settings
sections.description: Configure member roles (owner, member, guest) and data retention policies for sensitive projects

sections.title: Channel Tab Customization
sections.description: Add Power BI dashboards, SharePoint libraries, and OneNote notebooks directly into channels

sections.title: Case Study: Replicating a Real-World DevOps Channel Structure
sections.description: Build a sample channel mimicking common CI/CD communication patterns

chapters.title: Module 4: Meetings Mastery for Technical Teams

sections.title: Optimizing Meeting Settings
sections.description: Configure breakout rooms, recording storage locations, and guest access permissions

sections.title: Advanced Screen Sharing Techniques
sections.description: Share specific applications vs. full desktop; use annotation tools during code reviews

sections.title: Integrating with Productivity Tools
sections.description: Embed meeting recordings into SharePoint sites; schedule recurring meetings via Power Automate

sections.title: Technical Exercise: Simulate a Daily Standup Meeting
sections.description: Practice using the 'raise hand' feature, Q&A session integration, and post-meeting action item tracking

sections.title: Working with SharePoint Integration
sections.description: Upload files to team libraries; apply version control and check-out features

sections.title: Permissions Granularity
sections.description: Set unique permissions for folders vs. individual files within a shared library

sections.title: Conflict Resolution in Co-Editing
sections.description: Understand real-time co-authoring limitations and implement change tracking workflows

sections.title: Final Project: Create Secure Documentation Repository
sections.description: Design a file structure for a hypothetical project with appropriate access controls
